contentrichtext.text: {{For|species with only one sex|Gonochorism}} {{redirect|Unisexers|the Australian television series|The Unisexers}} {{wiktionarypar|unisex}} '''Unisex''' refers to things that are suitable for either [[gender]],<ref>[http://www.askoxford.com/concise_oed/unisex?view=uk AskOxford: unisex<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/unisex unisex - Definitions from Dictionary.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> but can also be another term for [[gender-blindness]]. The term was coined in the 1960s and was used fairly informally. Though the combining form ''uni-'' is from the Latin ''unus'' meaning ''one'', the term seems to have been influenced by words such as ''united'' and ''universal'' where the ''uni-'' prefix takes on the sense of ''shared''. In this sense, it can be seen as meaning ''shared by both sexes''.<ref>[http://www.askoxford.com/asktheexperts/faq/aboutwords/unisex?view=uk AskOxford: Why does 'unisex' refer to something to do with both sexes, not just one sex?<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Hair stylists and [[beauty salon]]s that serve both men and women are often referred to as unisex. This is also typical of other services that traditionally separated the sexes, such as clothing shops. ==See also== *[[Coeducation]] *[[Unisex name]] *[[Unisex dress]] *[[Gender-neutral toilet]] *[[Gender role]] *[[Gender mainstreaming]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Androgyny]] [[Category:Gender]] [[Category:Sexuality and society]]
